rationale: This course will provide an opportunity to the ICT students to learn about fundamentals of VLSI Technology such as trends in VLSI, MOSFET structure and Analysis of MOS circuits. In laboratory part of this course, students will be given exposure to develop RTL code for different types of digital circuits. This subject is very important for the students for their career advancement in VLSI field.
competency: Circuit design using MOS transistors and Develop and test Verilog programs for VLSI based electronic circuits.

courseOutcomes.description: Describe various VLSI design style, Design methodology, Design flow.
Understand structure and working of MOSFET and Scaling.
Understand characteristics of MOS inverter circuits for different load.
Design of combinational and sequential circuits using MOSFET.
Develop Verilog code for combinational and sequential design.

Simulate the Basic logic gates using Verilog
Simulate XOR and XNOR using Verilog
Simulate full adder using half adder in Verilog
Simulate four bit adder using Verilog
Simulate Parity generator and checker using Verilog
Simulate flip-flops (SR, D, T, JK) using Verilog
Simulate 4 bit Up counter using Verilog
Simulate 4 bit shift register using Verilog
Verify digital circuits by implementing testbench for it in Verilog
